abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Regional and Local
            Development Project for Jordan were as follows: outcomes
            were unsatisfactory, the risk to development outcome was
            substantial, the Bank performance was moderately
            unsatisfactory, and the Borrower performance was moderately
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            intergovernmental fiscal reform is a long and complex
            undertaking that requires strong leadership and multi-phased
            support and government continued commitment. A review of the
            political economy in such projects will help develop
            strategies to strengthen the responsible agencies.
            Addressing several diverse and complex themes in a limited
            capacity environment plants several seeds of reform but can
            limit the depth of success of each theme. Starting the
            process of reform with a simple project with limited but
            clear objectives could lead to better performance.
            Restructuring is an opportunity to formally clarify broad
            project development objectives, and align them with
            appropriate monitoring and evaluation frameworks. Demand
            driven municipal infrastructure and revenue earning
            sub-projects require clear definitions so as to enable
            private sector activities. Pilot database systems need
            adequate human and financial resources to be rolled out to
            the larger intended targets and to be updated with new
            information regularly for the system to be useful. Hands-on
            training provided during implementation (e.g. procurement
            and environment) help build knowledge and resolve problems
            to improve ratings.
